newsitem.title: FRANCE: French judge to probe Eurotunnel deals in London.
newsitem.headline: French judge to probe Eurotunnel deals in London.

text.p: French investigating magistrate Dominique de Talance said on Tuesday she would be going to London this month to meet officials of the Serious Fraud Squad (SFO) as part of her inquiry into alleged insider trading in Eurotunnel SA /Plc shares.

She told Reuters that she had also agreed with the U.S. authorities for officials from France's Brigade Financiere to go to New York in July to question representatives of George Soros, the Hungarian-born financier, as well as U.S. investment banks.
She will also appoint university experts to analyse share trading related to the May 1994 Eurotunnel rights issue.
De Talance said she would meet officials of the SFO, which investigates major financial crimes, and pass on her inquiries for them to follow up.
The visit is part of her "commission of investigation into institutions" connected to Eurotunnel's share movements, she said.

The Paris COB stockmarket regulator said in March last year "use of privileged information had not been established," after conducting its own inquiry. The COB also sent its report to the Paris public prosecutor.

SBC Warburg and Salomon Inc's Salomon Brothers, both underwriters in the 1994 capital increase, have confirmed they were subjects of the inquiry by the Commission des Operations de Bourse. Both have denied any wrongdoing.
Albert Jauffrey, chairman of a Eurotunnel small shareholders association, Adacte, said in a statement he would be making starting new legal actions in Paris soon, relating to Eurotunnel.
